snippet: Banks are setting aside cash to settle impending legal settlements, but they are not sharing their litigation reserve levels. | Goldman’s profit falls 19 percent. | A judge rejected Detroit’s plan to free itself from interest-rate swaps. | The...
abstract: Banks are setting aside cash to settle impending legal settlements, but they are not sharing their litigation reserve levels. | Goldman’s profit falls 19 percent. | A judge rejected Detroit’s plan to free itself from interest-rate swaps. | The Sacramento Kings will start accepting Bitcoin.

headline.main: Banks Keep Mouths Shut on Litigation Reserves
